metadata.titel_preek: The Sabbath Voice of the Evangel: Against Death, Denial, and Despair

locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explores the invitation of Jesus to the weary, contrasting the 'deeds of power' of the world with the 'sabbath voice' of Christ. He uses the metaphors of Pharaoh (coercion) and the abundance of creation (trust) to define weariness and rest.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Connects Matthew 11 to the surrounding context of Matthew 12 and Old Testament motifs (Pharaoh, Psalms, Jeremiah).

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily 'asserts' the nature of weariness and 'directs' the hearer toward truth-telling and hope-telling. There is a strong 'invitational' force that leans toward commissive in the final section.
voorbeelden: I submit, living a life that is against the grain of our true creatureliness.
Tell the truth about the pain of the ancient slaves.
Be like that today and all your days as you fall back into rest.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: The hearer should feel the weight of their 'pharaonic' burdens lifted and be moved to a state of 'sabbath wonder and joy.'
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The preacher speaks of 'power stirring in your life,' but does not explicitly invoke the Holy Spirit as the agent of the perlocutionary effect.

voorbeelden: Jesus does not always speak in that tone.
Exhaustion comes from the demand that we be other than who we truly are.
Pharaoh has insatiable demands.
Imagine yourself away from your wisdom.
Tell the truth about the pain.
Take my yoke upon you.
I suspect is not remote from your life.
Do you think that I exaggerate?
I propose...
I will give you rest.
You will be held, emancipated, and embraced.
You will find rest for your souls.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong, though often quoted from the text rather than formulated as a direct apostolic promise from the preacher's mouth.

voorbeelden: The truth will make us sabbath free.
You will dance.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher assumes the authority of a 'truth-teller' but stops short of 'I absolve you' or 'I declare you free.'

indicatoren: Extensive analysis of why we are weary.
Talking about the 'Friday people' and 'Sunday people' in the third person.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer gains profound insight into their condition but remains an observer of the 'sabbath' rather than a participant in it until the very end.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is given a 'to-do' list (Tell the truth, Tell hope) to achieve the performative state.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High quality, specifically in the Lipton ad metaphor.
voorbeelden: You will be held, emancipated, and embraced.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Used to build solidarity ('people like us') and to offer personal experience.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address increases significantly in the final third of the sermon.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to apply the promise of 'dancing' and 'rest'.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominates the exegesis of Pharaoh, the cities, and the 'truth-tellers'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere in the middle section.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about anxiety and creatureliness.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'now' of the invitation and the 'table'.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Analysis of weariness) -> Directive (You must tell the truth).
voorbeelden: We are weary because... So tell the truth.
foutief_patroon.probleem: It risks turning the 'easy yoke' into a new homiletical demand.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Jesus is gentle) -> Commissive (You will be held) -> Directive (Dance).
voorbeelden: Be like that today... you will be held... you will dance.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The ending achieves a sacramental 'event' character.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because the truth is told, you will find the weariness easing.
voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: Tell the truth... and you will end the power of denial (implies the hearer's action ends the power).

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon moves from a heavy diagnostic of the human condition to a beautiful, poetic promise of rest, though it spends much time 'talking about' the mechanics of truth-telling.

sterke_punten.effect: Makes the abstract concept of 'rest' tangible and desirable.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The repetitive 'Tell the truth... Tell hope...'
zwakke_punten.probleem: Can feel like a new set of 'brick quotas' for the weary preacher.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event in the final paragraphs where the language shifts to 'You will...'

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, the sermon begins by identifying Jesus as the one who speaks.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Partially; the preacher acts as a 'proposer' of an alternative reality.
tekstueel_bewijs: The one who speaks to us in this gospel text is Jesus.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Low. The Spirit is not explicitly mentioned.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher seems to rely on the 'power of the truth' itself to effect change.
tekstueel_bewijs: The truth will make us sabbath free.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, especially in the connection to 'the table'.
tekstueel_bewijs: As you come to the table, expect yourself to be subverted.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 'is' and 'are' (assertives) and 'tell' (directives). Needs more 'I promise' or 'Christ frees' (commissives/declaratives).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Sabbath rest consists in bringing our daily existence into congruity.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, in this word, Christ brings your life into congruity with Him.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a definition to an act of God.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often conditional on the hearer 'telling the truth'.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Make the promise unconditional based on Christ's work.
voorbeeldzinnen: Christ has already broken your silence; you are free to speak.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Maintain the 'You' focus of the conclusion throughout.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are the one Jesus is looking at when He says...

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The 'Tell the truth' section feels like a burden.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Frame truth-telling as a gift of the Spirit rather than a sabbath 'practice'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A deeply poetic and insightful sermon that successfully moves from the 'constative' analysis of exhaustion to a 'performative' invitation to joy.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies that the preacher isn't just sending a message about rest, but is the means through which Christ actually gives rest.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power is not in the 'Lipton' illustration's cleverness, but in its illocutionary force as a commissive act.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the 'Tell the truth' section, while rhetorically beautiful, functions as a 'Directive' which might accidentally increase the 'weariness' the preacher seeks to alleviate.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Tell the truth about the pain.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a masterclass in 'Locution' (theology/exegesis) but struggles slightly with 'Constative Surplus' in the middle section before a strong performative finish.
